intro: Oxydectes angustifrons, commonly known as the narrow-fruited oxydectes, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It produces small, elliptical fruits that are typically covered in fine hairs. Oxydectes angustifrons is often found in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests.
